edu.monash.fit2099.engine

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.engine.World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing the game world, including the locations of all Actors, the player, and the playing grid.

    • Method Detail

      • addGameMap

        public void addGameMap(GameMap gameMap)
        Add a GameMap to the World.
        Parameters:
        gameMap - the GameMap to add

      • addPlayer

        public void addPlayer(Actor player,
                      Location location)
        Set an actor as the player. The map is drawn just before this Actor's turn
        Parameters:
        player - the player to add
        location - the Location where the player is to be added

      • run

        public void run()
        Run the game. On each iteration the gameloop does the following: - displays the player's map - processes the actions of every Actor in the game, regardless of map We could either only process the actors on the current map, which would make time stop on the other maps, or we could process all the actors. We chose to process all the actors.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the player doesn't exist

      • processActorTurn

        protected void processActorTurn(Actor actor)
        Gives an Actor its turn. The Actions an Actor can take include:
        • those conferred by items it is carrying
        • movement actions for the current location and terrain
        • actions that can be done to Actors in adjacent squares
        • actions that can be done using items in the current location
        • skipping a turn
        Parameters:
        actor - the Actor whose turn it is.

      • stillRunning

        protected boolean stillRunning()
        Returns true if the game is still running. The game is considered to still be running if the player is still around.
        Returns:
        true if the player is still on the map.

      • endGameMessage

        protected java.lang.String endGameMessage()
        Return a string that can be displayed when the game ends.
        Returns:
        the string "Game Over"
